conversation.content: Um, hi, I'm... what's the word... disputing? Um, there's this chargeback thing and, uh, I know you're just doing your job here.
Okay okay, um, let me just—I need to pull that up. Can you, uh, give me your account number or, er, maybe the transaction ID if you have it?
Yeah it's, um... hold on... TRN-4428-BC. Sorry, I'm just, uh, really stressed about this whole thing.

No no, I totally, um, I understand. So I'm seeing transaction TRN-4428-BC here and, uh, there's a chargeback filed on October 15th for, hmm, $847.92. I wish I could just—sorry, let me check what options we have.
Eight hundred? That's... that's my insulin money.
Oh. Oh gosh. Okay. Let me see what—I mean, I'm looking at case number CHG-90122-X and. The system shows. Initial review pending. Status.
Um, look, I delivered everything. The, uh... what's it called... the tracking? Um, shows delivered, signed for, everything.
Right right, so I can see, um, tracking number TRK-556633-AA shows delivered October 2nd, and there's a, uh, signature from—wait, no sorry, that's October 3rd. But yeah, definitely delivered.
Can you, um, can you fix this? I mean, uh, I know it's not your fault the system's like this.

I really, really wish I could just, um, reverse this right now but, uh, the chargeback process is—it's handled by, hmm, a different department. Case CHG-90122-X needs to go through their review and I'm—I'm so frustrated I can't do more.
My kid needs that medication. Next week.
Okay. I'm going to. Escalate this. Priority one. Medical necessity flag on case CHG-90122-X. That should expedite to 24-48 hours instead of the normal two weeks.
Um, two weeks is the normal? That's, uh... god, thank you for, um, making it faster.
Yeah it's—it's ridiculous, I know. I'm also, um, I'm adding all your delivery proof to file DOC-7789-M right now, so they'll have the, uh, the signature, tracking, everything when they review.
You're really, um, you're being so helpful. I'm sorry I'm such a, uh, mess about this.
No no no, please don't—don't apologize. I'd be the same if, um, if it was my kid's medication. Reference number for this call is, uh, REC-445521-QV if you need to follow up.
REC... um, sorry, can you repeat that? My hands are, uh, kinda shaking.
Of course, of course. It's REC-445521-QV. And um, actually, let me—I'm putting a note here that you should, uh, you should get priority callback within 24 hours about case CHG-90122-X.
Twenty-four hours. Okay. That works. Thank you.
You're welcome. I just. I really hope this gets resolved quickly for you. The escalation team should call from 877-555-9900. Answer even if it looks like spam.
